alerts.headline: Wind Advisory issued February 13 at 11:33AM PST until February 18 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
alerts.description:
* WHAT...South winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts of 35 to 45 mph
expected.

* WHERE...Sacramento Valley.

* WHEN...From 10 AM Monday to 10 PM PST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects. Tree
limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result.
alerts.instruction:
Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high
profile vehicles. Use extra caution.
alerts.areaDesc: Northern Sacramento Valley; Central Sacramento Valley; Southern Sacramento Valley

alerts.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 12 at 8:17PM PST until February 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS San Francisco CA
alerts.description:
* WHAT...An increased risk of sneaker waves and strong rip
currents with breaking waves of 14 to 19 feet.

* WHERE...Northwest facing Pacific Coast beaches.

* WHEN...From 10 PM PST this evening through 4 AM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Dangerous conditions are forecast along the
shoreline. Hazards include sneaker waves, strong rip currents,
and large breaking waves.
alerts.instruction:
Stay off of jetties, piers, rocks, and other waterside
infrastructure. Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous surf
and NEVER turn your back on the ocean. Monitor local weather,
surf and tide forecasts at www.weather.gov/mtr.
alerts.areaDesc: San Francisco; Coastal North Bay Including Point Reyes National Seashore; San Francisco Peninsula Coast; Southern Monterey Bay and Big Sur Coast
